snippet: A California start-up helps studios cultivate potential audiences’ enthusiasm with early sales of tickets and movie-related products.
abstract: Kernel, start-up founded by self-described movie 'superfans' Dave Harvilicz and Andy Martinez, offers large movie studios way to capitalize on and maintain interest among fans for upcoming movies through early sales of tickets to premieres; tickets are often accompanied by products related to movie, and sales allow studios way to directly keep in contact with fans that lets them collect valuable information about viewing public.
lead_paragraph: A California start-up helps studios cultivate potential audiences’ enthusiasm with early sales of tickets and movie-related products.

headline.main: Engaging Movie Fans, From Teaser to Premiere
headline.print_headline: Engaging Movie Fans, From Teaser to Premiere
